critique: This document primarily concerns amendments to Selective Service Regulations, focusing on registration, classification, and procedures related to military service. It outlines specific criteria for deferments and classifications, particularly for members of reserve components. There is no direct indication of ideological bias, immigration policy, or economic regulation. The document appears to expand executive power slightly by modifying existing regulations. It centralizes control at the federal level by standardizing procedures for the Selective Service. The document leans towards prioritizing national security by ensuring the availability of manpower for military service. There is no explicit mention of social inclusion or exclusion.
